==Events==
* [[457]] &ndash; [[Majorian]] is acclaimed emperor of the [[Western Roman Empire]] and recognized by [[emperor Leo I the Thracian]].
* [[484]] &ndash; [[Alaric II]] succeeds his father [[Euric]] and becomes king of the [[Visigoths]]. He establishes his capital at [[Aire-sur-l'Adour]] (Southern [[Gaul]]). 
* [[893]] &ndash; An earthquake [[893 Dvin earthquake|destroys]] the city of [[Dvin]], [[Armenia]].
*[[1065]] &ndash; [[Westminster Abbey]] is [[Consecration|consecrated]].
*[[1308]] &ndash; The reign of [[Emperor Hanazono]], [[Emperor of Japan]], begins.
*[[1612]] &ndash; [[Galileo Galilei]] becomes the first [[astronomer]] to observe the [[planet]] [[Neptune]], although he mistakenly catalogued it as a [[Fixed stars|fixed star]].
*[[1768]] &ndash; King [[Taksin]]'s coronation achieved through conquest as a king of [[Thailand]] and established [[Thonburi]] as a capital.
*[[1795]] &ndash; Construction of [[Yonge Street]], formerly recognized as the longest street in the world, begins in [[York, Upper Canada]] (present-day [[Toronto|Toronto, Ontario]], [[Canada]]).
*[[1824]] &ndash; The [[Bathurst War]] comes to an end with the surrender of the Wiradjuri.
*[[1832]] &ndash; [[John C. Calhoun]] becomes the first [[Vice President of the United States]] to resign.
*[[1835]] &ndash; [[Osceola]] leads his [[Seminole]] warriors in [[Florida]] into the [[Seminole Wars|Second Seminole War]] against the [[United States Army]].
*[[1836]] &ndash; [[South Australia]] and [[Adelaide]] are founded.
*1836 &ndash; [[Spain]] recognizes the independence of [[Mexico]].
*[[1846]] &ndash; [[Iowa]] is admitted as the 29th [[U.S. state]].
*[[1867]] &ndash; [[United States]] claims [[Midway Atoll]], the first territory annexed outside Continental limits.
*[[1879]] &ndash; [[Tay Bridge disaster]]: The central part of the [[Tay Rail Bridge]] in [[Dundee]], [[Scotland]], [[United Kingdom of Great Britain and Ireland|United Kingdom]] collapses as a train passes over it, killing 75.
*[[1885]] &ndash; [[Indian National Congress]], a political party of [[India]] is founded in [[Mumbai|Bombay]], [[Presidencies and provinces of British India|British India]].
*[[1895]] &ndash; The [[Auguste and Louis Lumière|Lumière brothers]] perform for their first paying audience at the Grand Cafe in ''Boulevard des Capucines'', marking the debut of the [[movie theater|cinema]].
*1895 &ndash; [[Wilhelm Röntgen]] publishes a paper detailing his discovery of a new type of [[radiation]], which later will be known as [[x-ray]]s.
*[[1902]] &ndash; The [[Syracuse Pros|Syracuse Athletic Club]] [[World Series of Football (1902–1903)|defeated]] the [[New York (World Series of Football)|New York Philadelphians]], 5–0, in the [[indoor American football|first indoor professional football]] game, which was held at [[Madison Square Garden (1890)|Madison Square Garden]].
*[[1908]] &ndash; A [[1908 Messina earthquake|magnitude 7.2 earthquake]] rocks [[Messina|Messina, Sicily]], [[Italy]] killing over 75,000.
*[[1912]] &ndash; The first [[San Francisco Municipal Railway|municipally owned]] [[Tram|streetcar]]s take to the streets in [[San Francisco|San Francisco, California]].
*[[1918]] &ndash; [[Constance Markievicz]], while detained in Holloway prison, became the first woman to be elected [[Member of Parliament#United Kingdom|MP]] to the [[House of Commons of the United Kingdom|British House of Commons]].
*[[1935]] &ndash; ''[[Pravda]]'' publishes a letter by [[Pavel Postyshev]], who revives [[New Year tree]] tradition in the [[Soviet Union]].
*[[1941]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Operation Anthropoid]], the plot to assassinate high-ranking [[Nazism|Nazi]] officer [[Reinhard Heydrich]], commences.
*[[1943]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: After eight days of brutal [[urban warfare|house-to-house fighting]], the [[Battle of Ortona]] concludes with the victory of the [[1st Canadian Infantry Division]] over the [[1st Parachute Division (Germany)|German 1st Parachute Division]] and the capture of the Italian town of [[Ortona]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[Maurice Richard]] becomes the first player to score 8 points in one game of [[National Hockey League|NHL]] [[ice hockey]].
*[[1948]] &ndash; The [[Douglas DC-3|DC-3]] [[airliner]] ''[[1948 Airborne Transport DC-3 (DST) disappearance|NC16002]]'' disappears 50 miles south of [[Miami, Florida]].
*[[1956]] &ndash; [[Chin Peng]], [[David Marshall (Singaporean politician)|David Marshall]] and [[Tunku Abdul Rahman]] meet in [[Baling]], [[Federation of Malaya|Malaya]] to [[Baling Talks|try and resolve]] the [[Malayan Emergency]] situation.
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[1958 NFL Championship Game|"Greatest Game Ever Played"]] &ndash; [[History of the Indianapolis Colts|Baltimore Colts]] defeat the [[New York Giants]] in the first ever [[National Football League]] [[sudden death (sport)|sudden death]] [[Overtime (sports)|overtime]] game at [[New York]]'s [[Yankee Stadium (1923)|Yankee Stadium]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Kim Il-sung]], already [[List of Premiers of North Korea|Prime Minister of North Korea]] and [[First Secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea]], becomes the first [[President of North Korea]].
*[[1973]] &ndash; The [[Endangered Species Act]] is passed in the [[United States]].
*[[1978]] &ndash; With the crew investigating a problem with the landing gear, [[United Airlines Flight 173]] runs out of fuel and crashes in [[Portland, Oregon]], killing 10. As a result, [[United Airlines]] instituted the industry's first [[crew resource management]] program.
*[[1989]] &ndash; A [[1989 Newcastle earthquake|magnitude 5.6 earthquake]] hits [[Newcastle, New South Wales]], [[Australia]], killing 13 people.
*[[2000]] &ndash; U.S. retail giant [[Montgomery Ward]] announces it is going out of business after 128 years.
*[[2008]] &ndash; [[War in Somalia (2006–2009)|War in Somalia]]: The militaries of [[Somalia]]'s [[Transitional Federal Parliament|Transitional Federal Government]] and [[Ethiopia]]n troops [[Fall of Mogadishu (2006)|capture Mogadishu]] unopposed.
*[[2009]] &ndash; [[2009 Karachi bombing|Forty-three people die in a suicide bombing]] in [[Karachi]], [[Pakistan]], where [[Shia Islam|Shia]] Muslims are observing the [[Day of Ashura]].
*[[2010]] &ndash; [[Arab Spring]]: [[2010–2012 Algerian protests|Popular protests]] begin in [[Algeria]] against the government.
*[[2011]] &ndash; [[Uludere airstrike]]: [[Turkey|Turkish]] warplanes bomb 34 [[Kurdish people|Kurds]] of Turkish nationality in the district of [[Uludere]].
